title: Doctors gave me anti-depressants - until my daughter diagnosed the menopause
text:
Menopause is like death: you know it’s going to happen, but you don’t really believe it. Some women seem to experience it peacefully in their sleep. For me, it was like a beheading.

When it started two years ago, I was writing a book a year, and had a part time job as a criminal justice social worker. I remember waiting in line in the grotty kitchen at work, wondering how on earth I was going to complete all the work I had scheduled for the day. A friendly colleague was taking ages washing her mug in the sink, and a red mist rose in me. I wanted to grab her head and shove it into the sink. It terrified me.

When I wasn’t working, it was safer to stay in bed. I had always been a runner, but I couldn’t...
